content.question: The Mean Value Theorem can be applied to which of the following functions on the closed interval <math alttext="open bracket, negative 3 comma 3, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>[</mo><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mn>3</mn><mo>]</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="f of x, equals, x raised to the two thirds power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f of x, equals, the absolute value of, x minus 1, end absolute value" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><mo>|</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>|</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator x minus 2, and denominator x minus 5, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator x minus 5, and denominator x minus 2, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator x minus 2, and denominator x minus 5, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Provide reasons or rationales for solutions and conclusions.
